Cheltenham Festival Day 1 Races - Festival Handicap Chase Odds

There is always a big field for the William Hill Trophy making it a tough one for punters to make sense of; it is a pure stamina test for the horses so the weather can play a big part in the race. We have had some long priced winners of the race over the last few years including Joes Edge in 2007 at 50/1, and last season we saw a cracking performance from Alfie Sherrin at a nice price of 14/1.

The Festival Handicap Chase takes place on Day 1 of the Cheltenham Festival just before the Champion Hurdle; it has grown in popularity recently and should be another cracking renewal in 2015 with a big field. As the season progresses we will start to get a feel of potential runners, with that comes the ante post betting and that will be as competitive as ever for a top Festival race.
